description: In this course, the viewer will learn the following, design and implement functional networks as well as configuring, managing, and maintaining essential network devices. They will also look at various network devices such as routers and switches, also well as identifying  benefits and drawbacks of existing network configurations. They will also look at common network security, standards, and protocols and well as troubleshooting common network issues.
descriptionMD: In this course, the viewer will learn the following, design and implement functional networks as well as configuring, managing, and maintaining essential network devices. They will also look at various network devices such as routers and switches, also well as identifying  benefits and drawbacks of existing network configurations. They will also look at common network security, standards, and protocols and well as troubleshooting common network issues.
name: CompTIA Network+ (N10-007)
subtitle: Vendor-neutral networking

episodes.description: The Network+ certification was introduced by CompTIA in 1999 and was designed to do for Network Technicians what the A+ certification did for Computer Technicians. Obtaining Network+ certification shows that the holder possess the same knowledge and skills of someone who has worked for nine months as a Network Technician. The Network+ exam covers topics ranging from theory (terminology, topology and design) to hardware (routers, switches and cabling) and provides users with a broad, vendor neutral perspective on the topics required to work in the field of Network Administration.
episodes.title: Overview
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:02.794
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:02.794 --> 00:00:03.736
Welcome to ITProTV.
In this series,

3
00:00:03.736 --> 00:00:06.487
we're gonna be looking
at CompTIA's Net+ exam.

4
00:00:06.487 --> 00:00:09.817
We'll be looking at,
well, what is Network+?

5
00:00:09.817 --> 00:00:14.936
Who is this course for, what will be
covered, and what are some of the exam

6
00:00:14.936 --> 00:00:19.990
details, should you decide to sit For
your certification exam.

7
00:00:19.990 --> 00:00:24.810
Let's go ahead and let's dive right in and
talk about well, what is CompTIA's Net+?

8
00:00:24.810 --> 00:00:29.230
Well, it's actually a benchmark for
entry level network technicians.

9
00:00:29.230 --> 00:00:33.569
It's also accredited as
a 17024 certification by your

10
00:00:33.569 --> 00:00:37.323
International Organization
of Standardization.

11
00:00:37.323 --> 00:00:42.169
It's also FISMA compliant as well and
it is a worldwide accreditation.

12
00:00:42.169 --> 00:00:46.312
Meaning that it doesn't matter if
you're here where we are at ITPro.TV in

13
00:00:46.312 --> 00:00:47.440
the United States.

14
00:00:47.440 --> 00:00:50.883
If you get certified here, your
certification is recognized, well, let's

15
00:00:50.883 --> 00:00:54.500
say in Barcelona, Spain or if you're maybe
in the UK and you get certified there.

16
00:00:54.500 --> 00:00:55.596
Well, guess what?

17
00:00:55.596 --> 00:00:58.243
If you move or
travel over here to the states,

18
00:00:58.243 --> 00:01:00.690
your certification will be valid there.

19
00:01:00.690 --> 00:01:03.980
So it's worldwide recognization,
if you will.

20
00:01:03.980 --> 00:01:05.940
Worldwide recognized.

21
00:01:05.940 --> 00:01:09.478
Now, the next part is well,
who is this course for.

22
00:01:09.478 --> 00:01:12.290
Well, candidates that
require certification.

23
00:01:12.290 --> 00:01:14.866
We're gonna go heavy into
the exam objectives and

24
00:01:14.866 --> 00:01:18.620
following by those exam objectives,
we will be covering those topics.

25
00:01:18.620 --> 00:01:24.353
Candidates that need to understand
the basic concepts of setting up and

26
00:01:24.353 --> 00:01:29.706
maintaining network communications or
candidates that are going

27
00:01:29.706 --> 00:01:36.420
to take the exam that is based on
CompTIA's Net+ N10-007 exam objectives.

28
00:01:36.420 --> 00:01:37.874
So what will be covered here?

29
00:01:37.874 --> 00:01:42.020
Like we said, the objectives for
specifically exam code N10007.

30
00:01:42.020 --> 00:01:46.590
We'll be looking at things like
the fundamental networking concepts.

31
00:01:47.610 --> 00:01:50.937
The knowledge that you need to establish,
maintain and

32
00:01:50.937 --> 00:01:53.643
to troubleshoot your network connections.

33
00:01:53.643 --> 00:01:58.335
We'll also be looking at establishing
a basic understanding of enterprise level

34
00:01:58.335 --> 00:02:02.007
technologies and that conclude
anything from small networks,

35
00:02:02.007 --> 00:02:06.020
large networks to cloud and
virtualization technologies likewise.

36
00:02:06.020 --> 00:02:11.150
We'll also be looking at the basis for
network security and access control.

37
00:02:11.150 --> 00:02:16.030
Likewise, you're gonna learn an
understanding of the common communication

38
00:02:16.030 --> 00:02:19.560
protocols and the network connection
models and standardizations and

39
00:02:19.560 --> 00:02:24.530
specifications that we need when
setting up and understanding networks.

40
00:02:26.680 --> 00:02:28.000
So what are some of the exam details?

41
00:02:28.000 --> 00:02:33.377
Well, when you do decide to
sit the CompTIA Net+ 007 exam,

42
00:02:33.377 --> 00:02:39.120
you're gonna have 90 questions and
right around 90 minutes.

43
00:02:39.120 --> 00:02:42.202
This is gonna be a multiple choice or
performance and

44
00:02:42.202 --> 00:02:44.242
performance-based questions.

45
00:02:44.242 --> 00:02:45.770
We say, multiple choice.

46
00:02:45.770 --> 00:02:48.204
That means you can choose
one of the answers.

47
00:02:48.204 --> 00:02:50.970
It'll also have multiple answer questions.

48
00:02:50.970 --> 00:02:54.351
In the performance-based questions,
you might see where it says, choose two.

49
00:02:54.351 --> 00:02:56.481
Each of these two answers represents or

50
00:02:56.481 --> 00:02:59.650
each of these two answers
represent a complete solution.

51
00:02:59.650 --> 00:03:04.506
Performance-based questions can also be
things like simulations where they ask

52
00:03:04.506 --> 00:03:09.360
you to perform some kind of functionality
in order to get the answer right.

53
00:03:09.360 --> 00:03:13.018
It could be things like drag and
drops where they give you a list of items

54
00:03:13.018 --> 00:03:17.431
that you can drag from one column, and put
them in the right order in another column.

55
00:03:17.431 --> 00:03:22.047
You could see things like even diagrams
that ask you to solve a networking

56
00:03:22.047 --> 00:03:23.160
question.

57
00:03:23.160 --> 00:03:27.467
So keep that in mind that it is not
just going to be multiple choice.

58
00:03:27.467 --> 00:03:32.290
When you sit this exam,
the exams that CompTIA offers

59
00:03:32.290 --> 00:03:36.051
have a scoring range of 100 to 900.

60
00:03:36.051 --> 00:03:38.825
And for the Net+ exam or Network+ exam,

61
00:03:38.825 --> 00:03:44.280
you're gonna have to achieve a 720 or
higher in order to pass this exam.

62
00:03:44.280 --> 00:03:49.020
At the time of this recording,
the exam price was $294.

63
00:03:49.020 --> 00:03:53.432
Always keep in mind, check out CompTIA's
website to ensure that you have

64
00:03:53.432 --> 00:03:56.075
the latest update at pricing information.

65
00:03:56.075 --> 00:04:01.623
Now it is recommended, but not required
that you have A+ certification and

66
00:04:01.623 --> 00:04:06.510
somewhere between 9 to 12 months
of IT networking experience.

67
00:04:06.510 --> 00:04:09.752
Let's go ahead and
take this a little further and

68
00:04:09.752 --> 00:04:14.905
look at how the domains break up for

69
00:04:14.905 --> 00:04:17.670
As you can see,
we have five domains total.

70

You can see that we have networking
concepts comprised 23% of

71

the overall exam.

72
00:04:22.497 --> 00:04:27.323
We will be looking at things like
infrastructure as well at 18% of the exam.

73

Likewise, you'll see that
there are network operations.

74
00:04:30.360 --> 00:04:35.077
Domain 3.0 comprised of
17% of your overall exam.

75
00:04:35.077 --> 00:04:36.730
We also have network security.

76
00:04:36.730 --> 00:04:38.551
It's gonna be important to
keep those networks secure.

77
00:04:38.551 --> 00:04:41.950
That comprises over 20%
of your overall exam.

78
00:04:41.950 --> 00:04:44.421
And then last, but certainly not least,

79
00:04:44.421 --> 00:04:49.717
what's always on everybody's mind when the
network is the network troubleshooting and

80
00:04:49.717 --> 00:04:52.542
the tools that help assist
troubleshooting and

81

that is going to be 22% of your
overall exam for a total of 100%.

82
00:04:56.721 --> 00:05:02.330
So these are some of the domains

83
00:05:02.330 --> 00:05:06.212
If this interests you and

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes explore different ports and protocols used for communication in modern computer networks. They look at protocols like SSH, DNS, FTP.....etc and their associated ports.
episodes.title: Ports and Protocols

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes explore different ports and protocols used for communication in modern computer networks. They look at protocols like SSH, DNS, FTP.....etc and their associated ports.
episodes.title: Ports and Protocols Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes dive into the Open Systems Interconnection model \(OSI model\). They look at some of the applications, devices and protocols that operated within the different layers of the OSI model.
episodes.title: OSI Model

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes dive into the various characteristics and attributes of network communications. They look at concepts like unicast, multicast, broadcast domains and more.
episodes.title: Network Traffic Properties

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes dive into the various characteristics and attributes of network communications. They look at concepts like CSMA/CD and CSMA/CA as well as MTUs and PDUs.
episodes.title: Network Traffic Properties Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes dive into the various characteristics and attributes of switching technologies. They look at concepts like unicast, multicast, broadcast domains and more.
episodes.title: Switching Technologies

episodes.description: In this episode Zach Wes dive into the various characteristics and attributes of routing technologies. They will look routing protocols like difference between interior gateway routing protocols and exterior gateway routing protocols. They will talk about a distance-vector routing protocol known as RIP and RIPv2.
episodes.title: Routing Technologies

episodes.description: In this episode Zach Wes dive into the various characteristics and attributes of routing technologies. They look at distance-vector protocols like EIGRP, a link-state routing protocol called OSPF as well as a path-vector routing protocol called BGP. They will look at other concepts like NAT and PAT, routing types and port forwarding
episodes.title: Routing Technologies Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes dive into the concepts surrounding performance of the network. They look at some of the ways networks can grant specific types of traffic more or less of the network resources to ensure quality-of-service.
episodes.title: Network Performance Concepts

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes explore the basic concepts of IP addressing. They look an IP address format and how to convert IP addresses from decimal format to binary format as well as base10 and base2 numbering systems.
episodes.title: IP Addressing

episodes.description: In this episode Ronnie and Wes explore the basic concepts of IP addressing. They continue their look at subnet masks and decimal to binary conversion. They explain subnet masks.
episodes.title: IP Addressing Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode Ronnie and Wes explore the basic concepts of IP addressing. They explain in more detail how subnet masks apply to ip addresses, as well as how to identify the network versus node portions of an IP address.
episodes.title: IP Addressing Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode -- and Wes explore the basic concepts of IP addressing. They look at topics like classful vs. classless addressing, subnet masks, subnetting and IP address assignments.
episodes.title: IP Addressing Part 4

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes explore the basic concepts of IP addressing. They look at classless subnet masks and the valid subnet mask ranges as well as some tips for the exam.
episodes.title: Classless IPv4 Addressing

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes explore the basic concepts of IP addressing. They look at classless subnet masks and the valid subnet mask ranges as well as some tips for the exam.
episodes.title: Classless IPv4 Addressing Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes continue their exploration on  the basic concepts of subnetting. They look applying classless subnet masks to networks to create smaller networks. They demonstate the concepts with examples.
episodes.title: Classless IPv4 Addressing Part 3

episodes.description: n this episode Zach and Wes continue their exploration on the basic concepts of subnetting. They look applying classless subnet masks to a larger network to create smaller networks. They continue their demonstatation of the concepts with additional examples inluding VLSM
episodes.title: Classless IPv4 Addressing Part 4

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes dive into how IP addresses are configured on nodes inside of modern networks. The look at concepts like DHCP, static assignments, EUI-64 and more
episodes.title: IP Address Assignments

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes explore the basic concepts of IPv6 addressing. They look at topics like tunneling, dual stack, router advertisements and neighbor discovery

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes explore the basic concepts of IPv6 addressing. They look at topics like tunneling, dual stack, router advertisements and neighbor discovery
episodes.title: IPv6 Addressing Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes discuss different network topologies. They will look at the different network types like LANs, WANs and WLANs. They will also look at various concepts surrounding Internet of Things or IoT
episodes.title: Network Topologies

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes explore various wireless networking technologies like 802.11 standards, frequencies, speeds and distances. They will also look at some different cellular technologies such as GSM, TMDA and CDMA.
episodes.title: Wireless Technologies

episodes.description: In this episode Justin and Wes explore technologies that help to support the cloud. They look at the different services offered by cloud providers such as SaaS, PaaS and IaaS as well as the delivery models.
episodes.title: Cloud Concepts

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes take a look into various network services functions. THey will look at characteristics of the domain name system \(DNS\)and the dynamic host configuration protocol \(DHCP\).

episodes.description: In this episode -- and Wes take a look into various network services functions. THey will look at characteristics of the domain name system \(DNS\)and the dynamic host configuration protocol \(DHCP\).

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes look at some of the common networking attacks that administrators need to protect against. They will discuss attacks like various denial-of-service attacks, phishing, social engineering, evil twin attacks, spoofing and more.
